SENT.plain: Maffucci syndrome consists of subcutaneous hemangiomata and multiple enchondromata
The incidence of malignancy associated with the disease is 23%, of which 15.2% is a malignant transformation of enchondromata to chondrosarcoma
Periodic follow-up of the patient is advised
When malignant transformation is suspected, a bone scan may be useful for diagnosis, especially when done sequentially
Ninety-four percent of the patients can live a reasonably normal life, although two-thirds of them require some surgical intervention
